bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: "Death of Abraham Lincoln" (ms. fragment), [1889]
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman Collection, 1842-1957, Rare Book & Manuscript Library, University of Pennsylvania
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.p: Of Abraham Lincoln, ‸bearing testimony, twenty five years after his death—and of that death—I am no my friendsfor a few minutes before you,. bearing testimonyFew realize of the great days, the great, ‸historic and esthetic personalities we have justlately pass'd through. Abraham Lincoln, ‸familiar, our own, an Illinoisian, ‸modern yet tallying of ‸ancient Moses, Joshua, ‸Ulysses, Socrates, Rabelais, or later ‸Michel Angelo Cromwell, and grander in some respects than any of them; Abraham Lincoln that makes ‸such as Homer, Plutarch, Shakspere, possible. My subject to you my friends this evening for my 40 or 50 minutes' talk is the Death of Abraham Lincolnthis man, and how that death wil affect America. I am not going to tell you any thing new; and it is ‸ doubtless
